text:
In terms of skills...I think the most important skill I've seen in any company is being able to verbally communicate well. Those that do well can talk to groups of people and persuade them to do something and lead a team. 

This applies to any department i.e. a finance team, marketing team, sales team or IT team. It helps you stand out from the crowd and your peers. This is especially true in areas such as IT/coding as your peers are likely to be less experienced or able to speak well & lead large groups of people. So if you can develop 2 very different but complimenting skills (such as coding/IT and being a good public speaker/leader) then you will do well. 

If you have opportunities for public speaking
